alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:43PM CDT until July 10 at 9:06AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Pottawatomie, Oklahoma and Lincoln Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Look for short duration flooding of low-lying agricultural lands and rural roads in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of lincoln... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 14.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 10.2 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM CDT.
